intro: Bouvardia triflora, commonly known as the pink bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a trailing vine, with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Bouvardia triflora is popular in floral arrangements due to its delicate appearance and long-lasting blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
